title: The effect of Greek mountain tea extract and wheat germ extract on peripheral blood flow and eicosanoid metabolism in mammals.
abstract: Polyphenols are a group of compounds identified as secondary metabolites of plants, with 8,000 types identified to date. Previous research findings have indicated the potential anti-inflammatory properties of polyphenols, with studies suggesting a reduction in disease risk and therapeutic benefits observed in various diseases, including diabesity, neurodegeneration, cancer, and cardiovascular disease.
